availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry D. Palmer (Fleming Co., captain 16th Ky. Vol. Inf.)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Edumund Palmer and Margaret Chandler Palmer. Student in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain, from February 28, 1862, to November 30, 1864. Killed in action at Franklin, Tennessee, on November 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 306A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film #000281843, p. 409 of 515 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0295.
Find A Grave, "Capt Henry D. Palmer (1836-1864)," Memorial #62646833, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62646833 (accessed November 5, 2020).
